page.title: 07National Trust Youth Theatre
page.content: At 2.00pm on 19th June the return of Queen Elizabeth 1 to Knole House was celebrated. The Queen entered through the outer courtyard, into the inner courtyard. The household then knelt in front of her. All the drums were being played very loudly, then the actors started their play. The story started with the Stricken Wood where a brave knight saved it from the merry maidens,this was for the Queen's entertainment. When the Queen laughed everybody else had to laugh, when she was angry everybody had to kneel. When the wind was mentioned we had to make a noise like the wind and when the Stricken Wood was mentioned we had to make a groan and curl up. After the story the Queen got angry and started to go back home.She came back but she had business to deal with. We enjoyed it very much.
